messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Cruise
messages.msgSnippet: We have five so we would have to get two rooms, but MAYBE if another family of five is in the same predicament, we could split a second room and have a kid or
messages.messageBody:
We have five so we would have to get two rooms, but MAYBE if another family
of five is in the same predicament, we could split a second room and have a
kid
or two of theirs share with a kid or two of ours?

We're going to think about it without mentioning it to the kids. It's a
kind
of sudden investment situation. But to be with other unschooling whole
families for that long is a huge temptation.>>>>>>>>>>>

I am hugely intrigued by this cruise! We are a family of 5, well actually 6
counting the
baby. I am sure they will make me count him for a cruise though. He will be
just one at
that time. I was thinking the same thing about sharing a room. My parents
love to
travel, sothey might be willling to go with us. Guess I better check out
airfares. That
could blow us out of the water. I think that price (not that I have ever
checked)
seems really reasonable for a family for a week vacation to exotic locals.
And wow,
with unschoolers to boot? I better go check the airline link....

Kathy
